value: Cockerels, Lampang's emblem, watch sunset over the river.

(นครลำปาง), is a city in the

Lampang, in the Wang River basin, has been occupied by various civilisations, including Hariphunchai, Lanna, and Burmese, for more than 1,000 years and has a rich archaeological record. It is also known its nostalgic local transport: horse-drawn carriages, rather than tuk-tuks.
) is currently served by daily turboprop flights by

Suvarnabhumi Airport (BKK) at around 2 hours from/to Bangkok (2,400 baht and up).

A cheaper option is to take a low-cost flight (Air Asia, Nok Air) to
, then connect to Lampang by bus.

passes through Lampang. As such, there are several trains in either direction every day. The journey from Bangkok takes 10-12 hours; 2nd class air-con sleeper ticket costs 734-804 baht, air-con seat car is 574 baht. 2nd class fan sleeper is 150-200 baht cheaper than air-con. 

From Chiang Mai, the trip takes around 2 hours. Express fan car tickets are 23 baht. Air-con car tickets are just over 100 baht.
Many buses run from Bangkok's Mo Chit terminal, most of which continue on to

. First-class air-con bus ticket costs around 400-450 baht, the trip takes 8-9 hours (as such, overnight buses are recommended).

From Chiang Mai (Arcade bus station), buses are very frequent, and it takes just around 1-1.5 hours to get to Lampang. The price is 40-90 baht, depending on the class (first class air-con bus costs 90 baht)

Finally, many buses going from Chiang Mai to various other destinations in central and northeast Thailand stop in Lampang, so it is pretty well connected.

There are no tuk-tuks, so either use the horse-drawn carriages or the songthaews, which can be hired like a tuk-tuk. If it is not on a fixed route, ask the driver for a price but be sure that you both understand whether the price is for the trip or per person.

value: Pack your trunk and head to the
address=km28-29 Lampang-Chiang Mai Hwy, Hang Chat
content=Originally log-lugging beasts of burden, Lampang's elephants are now better looked after and can be visited by tourists.
content=Temple contains Thailand's second "emerald" Buddha, the other being in Bangkok.
content=Traditional Lanna architecture on the site of ancient Lampang city. It is famous for its murals from the 19th century. The city seal features a white cockerel in the temple's gate.

content=Lampang is a major ceramics centre of Thailand. Up and down Hwy 11 you will find ceramics factories with outlets. An especially good one is Sangchai, where you can stock up on all the cockerel-laden bowls you need, along with local goodies like khao tan biscuits. It's common to see out-of-town Thais shopping for souvenirs.
content=Excellent, mainly visited by locals but definitely advisable for tourists.
directions=about a kilometre down the road from the clock tower circle
content=Many assorted cheap food stalls with tables and seating. On the left at the market entrance is a 7-Eleven that sells (and opens) beer bottles and soft drinks to go with your meal.
content=Traditional & local Thai food. Live music every night. Friendly English-speaking staff. A great place to hang out and have fun.
directions=near Riverside Restaurant and Aroy One Baht
content=On Saturday and Sunday nights, everyone turns out for the walking street! Eat lots of food and buy things!
directions=corner of Tipchang Rd and Talat Kao
content=Cosy coffee shop with free Wi-Fi.
content=Wooden colonial house, family-run, clean, great value.
content=Clean rooms, central location. Often full.
content=Often full. Also has good restaurant.
directions=In front of Riverside Guesthouse on Talad Kao Rd
price=250 baht for double with en suite bath and fan
content=Run by a nice Thai couple. They have a small garden access to the small parking lot just in front of Please Bar and Gibbon Bar.
directions=Downtown, a few blocks from the Clock Tower

content=Quite acceptable. From the bus station, a songthaew charges 40-60 baht. The hotel is a little dated, but clean and the air-con is good. The breakfast is a choice of either two Thai dishes of rice porridge or fried noodle, or toast and jam. There is Internet at the hotel, and an Internet cafe is difficult to locate anywhere near the hotel.
